intro: Endospermum domatiophorum, commonly known as the ghost gum, is a small to medium-sized tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark that peels in thin, papery layers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round fruits. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with a distinctive yellowish-green color. The endospermum domatiophorum is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
